5.723 Warga Sumut Terinfeksi DBD
01 Nov 2019, 17:46 by Indra Widyastuti


5.723 Warga Sumut Terinfeksi DBD

KBRN, Medan : Sebanyak 5.723 warga Sumatera Utara (Sumut) terinfeksi Demam Berdarah Dengue (DBD) selama Januari hingga Agustus 2019. Dari jumlah tersebut, 30 orang diantaranya meninggal dunia.
Kepala Dinas Kesehatan Sumut, dr Alwi Mujahit Hasibuan melalui Kepala seksi Bidang Pengendalian dan Pemberantasan Penyakit Menular(P2P) Yulia Maryani mengatakan, pihaknya terus melakukan program Juru Pemantau Jentik (Jumantik) sebagai upaya menanggulangi penyakit tersebut.
“Program Jumantik itu, ada orang yang diberi tugas untuk memantau jentik nyamuk dari rumah ke rumah," katanya di Medan, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Selain program jumantik, Dinkes Sumut terus menyebarkan informasi waspada DBD terhadap lintas program dan lintas sektor serta stakeholder daerah. Survey faktor risiko DBD juga terus dilakukan di beberapa kabupaten/kota dengan tujuan mengetahui faktor risiko yang ada di daerah. 
Tidak hanya itu, pertemuan tatalaksana kasus DBD di beberapa kabupaten/ kota juga dilakukan untuk penegasan bagi petugas pelayanan kesehatan tentang SOP tatalaksana kasus DBD sesuai Peraturan Kementerian Kesehatan. 
"Kita juga mengkoordinasikan gerakan 1 rumah 1 jumantik (G1R1J) di beberapa kabupaten/kota, dengan tujuan terbentuknya SK jumantik tingkat kabupaten/kota dan tersusunnya tim dan terlaksananya G1R1J. Dan, penyelidikan epidemiologi terhadap kasus yang ditemukan serta pendistribusi logistik DBD," ungkapnya.
Berdasarkan data dari Dinkes Sumut, selama Januari sampai Agustus 2019, dari 33 kabupaten kota se-Sumut, tercatat sejumlah daerah dengan DBD tertinggi, yakni Kota Medan sebanyak 839 terinfeksi meninggal 6 orang, Kabupaten Deli Serdang 1.056 terinfeksi dan meninggal 1 orang, Kabupaten Asahan dengan 496 terinfeksi meninggal 4 orang, dan Kabupaten Simalungun sebanyak 481 terinfeksi dan 3 orang meninggal dunia.

5,723 North Sumatra Residents Infected by DHF
Nov 01 2019, 17:46 by Indra Widyastuti


5,723 North Sumatra Residents Infected by DHF

KBRN, Medan: A total of 5,723 North Sumatra (North Sumatra) residents were infected with Dengue Hemorrhagic Fever (DHF) during January to August 2019. Of these, 30 of them died.
Head of the North Sumatra Health Service, Dr. Alwi Mujahit Hasibuan through the Head of the Section of Disease Control and Eradication (P2P) Yulia Maryani said, it continues to carry out the larvae monitoring program (Jumantik) as an effort to tackle the disease.
"The Jumantik Program, there are people who are given the task to monitor mosquito larvae from house to house," he said in Medan, Friday (1/11/2019).
In addition to the jumantik program, the North Sumatra Health Office continues to disseminate DHF alert information on cross-program and cross-sectoral and regional stakeholders. DHF risk factor surveys also continue to be carried out in several districts / cities with the aim of knowing existing risk factors in the regions.
Not only that, the meeting of the management of dengue cases in several districts / cities was also held to affirm for health service officers about the SOP on management of dengue cases in accordance with Ministry of Health Regulations.
"We also coordinate the movement of 1 jumantik 1 house (G1R1J) in several districts / cities, with the aim of establishing district / city level jumantik decree and the formation of a team and the implementation of G1R1J.
Based on data from the North Sumatra Health Office, from January to August 2019, from 33 regencies of cities in North Sumatra, recorded a number of areas with the highest DHF, namely Medan City as many as 839 infected with 6 dead, Deli Serdang Regency 1,056 infected and 1 dead, Asahan District with 496 infected died 4 people, and Simalungun District 481 infected and 3 people died.
